text: "You" is a 1998 song recorded by Swedish Eurodance band La Cream. It was released as the second single from their only album, Sound & Vision and was a big hit especially in Scandinavia. The single peaked at number 3 in Norway and number 12 in Sweden. It is sung by lead vocalist Tess Mattisson and is mostly sung in English, but some of the lyrics are also in French. Executive producer of the song is Dr. Alban. The music video of "You" was shot in Stockholm City Hall. It features Mattisson performing in several rooms, like the Golden Hall. ==Critical reception== Music & Media wrote in their review of the song: "This Swedish duo consists of singer/dancer Tess—who has worked with Dr. Alban, Basic Element and Dromhus—and DJ/rapper Andrez who has considerable club experience. Together they have come up with a potent slice of Eurodance. The song is already doing very well in Sweden and Norway, and it has the potential to repeat that success elsewhere." ==Track listing== ==Chart performance== ===Weekly charts=== {|class="wikitable sortable" !
